Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is an overreach of government authority.
It poses a threat to free speech and breaches the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
The bill lacks clear definitions, such as what constitutes 'harm'.
The ACMA should not have the power to determine misinformation or disinformation.
The bill is seen as a move towards totalitarian control and undermines democratic processes.
Main Themes: Lack of clarity and precision in the legislation
Notable Quotes: The Government’s proposed Bill is a dangerous attack on ‘Free speech’ and is in breach of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
It represents a dangerous intrusion on civil and personal liberties and has all the hallmarks of ‘totalitarian control’.
All silencing of discussion is an assumption of infallibility.
